headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Netanyahu Faces Protests; Brian Anderson is Interviewed about Kansas State's Win. Aired 8:30-9a ET

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Coach, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You know what the happiest animal on earth is? Goldfish. You know why?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They've got a 10 second memory. Be a goldfish, Sam.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.(END VIDEO CLIP) (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, CNN CHIEF WASHINGTON CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Yes. HARLOW

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Well, it's interesting because the attorney general of Israel has said that Netanyahu is breaking the law.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Because there was a court mandated conflict of -- conflict of interest agreement when his government formed in which he agreed to not do anything related to the judiciary, given the fact that he's on trial for these separate corruption charges. And he seems to not be, at least according to the attorney general of Israel, adhering to that agreement, by actually taking steps to weaken the judiciary. The move that just happened, obviously, makes it tougher for judges, for judiciary to remove a prime minister. And actually he now, after that law passed, and Netanyahu said that his hands are no longer tied. So, there is a brazenness about this, and I guess we'll see how it plays out in terms of Netanyahu trying to weaken the independent judiciary in Israel.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Jake, I want to talk to you about something else because I can't wait to -- to see this tonight. Has this -- something that has a huge cultural impact. You sat down with the star and the co-creator of the smash hit "Ted Lasso." I mean, everyone is talking about "Ted Lasso," right. Jason Sudeikis is who I'm talking about. This is an interview that's going to air tonight, 9Here it is. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Since I've known you, you've always been very in touch with your humanity. You've always been very in touch with, like -- and acknowledging of insecurities, imposter syndrome.JASON SUDEIKIS, STAR AND CO-CREATOR, "TED LASSO": True.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I mean, you talk very openly about this.

utterances.speaker: SUDEIKIS
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: And it's such a part of the DNA of Ted Lasso.

utterances.speaker: SUDEIKIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Why? Like, what does that come from?

utterances.speaker: SUDEIKIS
utterances.sentences: I think again this innate sense that we're all more, you know, similar than sometimes we're allowed to feel or want to feel.There is something worse out there than being sad, and that is being alone and being sad. Ain't nobody in this room alone. And I don't think I was always that way. Or maybe I was, but I would only share it with a few people. Sometimes maybe people I didn't know that. But I also didn't want to burden folks with it, you know? And I think any of us can feel that way where we don't want to burden our stuff with other people because we don't think we're worthy of it, we don't think they want to hear it, and I still struggle with it. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, this is more relatable to, I think, everyone, especially coming out of Covid, right, and dealing with -- we still don't know the impact of mental health issues following Covid. But it's something that many of us on the air have been very transparent about, depression, getting therapy and so on and so forth. I don't think it was a surprise to you that Jason Sudeikis would admit that, imposter syndrome, and such and such. I think many, many people suffer from issues like that.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, and I think it's one of the reasons why Jason has been so successful in this role, taking what was kind of just a funny ad campaign idea in 2013 and taking -- and turning it into this award- winning show. It's only been -- there have only been two seasons and they've already won 11 Emmys and broken records for premieres on Apple TV Plus. And I think it's that humanity, the acknowledgement of the humanity, that comes through in Ted Lasso that is one of the reasons why, especially emerging as it did in 2020, in the midst of Covid, in the midst of a pretty nasty political season, why so many people have found comfort in it, why it has become such a cultural phenomenon.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. And they were just at the White House discussing the issue -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, on mental health.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: On mental health, talking about this, I mean even elevating the issue even more.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes. No, it's remarkable. And we talked about that, too. Obviously Jason, when he was on "SNL," he would play Joe Biden. I thought rather hilariously. I thought his -- I thought his Biden was the best Bidens of all the Bidens. But, of course, it was a different Biden. It was the 2008 Biden, not the 2023 Biden. But -- so that was interesting, too, that he got to -- that he had this encounter with President Biden, who he had played to hilarious effect previously.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I can't wait to see it tonight.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. My favorite Jason Sudeikis "SNL" was the tracksuit and the gold chain backup dancer. That's my favorite one.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.Jake, can't wait.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you. TAPPER

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, what up - what up with that. What up with that.Thank you. It's good to see you, Jake. We'll be watching this weekend. Have a great weekend, all right.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: See you, guys.

utterances.speaker: DLL
utterances.sentences: All right, we'll be watching tonight as well.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Bye.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Jake's sit down interview with Jason Sudeikis airs on CNN - CNN primetime. That's tonight, 9

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Well, from one funny man to another, this weekend, only here on CNN, you can also watch Adam Sandler received the Mark Twain Prize for American Humor. A preview is next.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ADAM SANDLER, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: Don't you say that. Don't you ever say that. Stay here. Stay as long as you can. For the love of God, cherish it.(END VIDEO CLIP) (COMMERCIAL BREAK) (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ADAM SANDLER, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: Are you too good for your home? Answer me.Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha. Shut up. You want a Happy Meal? We'll get one of those Happy Meals. You got a Happy Meal? Can we get a Happy Meal? Will somebody get the kid a Happy Meal. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: On the big screen he was the master -- is the master at playing goofy but lovable guy next door characters, also delivers complex characters in one of my favorite movies when he was a ruthless diamond dealer in "Uncut Gems" and an NBA scout for the Philadelphia 76ers in "Hustle," also a great movie.Through it all, Sandler remains an artist his co-stars admire. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I feel like in a great way he's already cemented his place in comedy history.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He's always been very, very real. And I think that's what people really connect with.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If you have to have a number one, he is. Nobody's lasted this long with this big a career.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think, you know, his comedy will live on for generations. So, some day they'll be giving the Adam Sandler award.

utterances.speaker: ADAM SANDLER, ACTOR, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: My father was the man who showed me comedy growing up. He showed me the Marx Brothers and Jerry Lewis.My dad always told me I could work for him. He'd say - he'd say to me, try it out a year or two. If it doesn't go well, you become an electrical contractor with me. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Sunday night you can watch Sandler receive his honor with some of his famous friends, including co-stars Jennifer Aniston, Judd Apatow, Drew Barrymore, all on CNN, 8

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Can't wait to watch that.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Cannot wait.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, it's in the name, right? There were some sweet -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Nice one.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Wins during the Sweet Sixteen rounds of March Madness. We're breaking down the major wins and the mad upsets. That's next.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Do you watch (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: No, I mean, I'm - I'm a sports fan. I'm just - HARLOW

utterances.speaker: BRIAN ANDERSON, WBD SPORTS COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Walker (ph). Walker, and he's stripped by Nowell. The ball is loose. Nowell comes out of the pack. Nowell dribbles and he (INAUDIBLE) it in. Count the basket and Kansas State wins it. The Wildcats are headed for the Elite Eight. What a game.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I wonder who's mellifluous voice that is.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Whose voice was that?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Who's that? Third seeded Kansas State took down seventh seed Michigan State in a thrilling Sweet Sixteen classic. I can't do it like that. The Wildcats clawing their way to the Elite Eight in overtime.Joining us now, the man whose voice you just heard calling the action is Brian Anderson, play by play announcer covering the tournament with -- just down the street at Madison Square Garden here in New York City. Hello. Do you get - welcome.

utterances.speaker: BRIAN ANDERSON, WBD SPORTS COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You said you're not usually up this early, so let me get your energy up.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: We're second shifters, Don. You got me up way too early. I got it at midnight last night, but it's good.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Do you get caught up in the emotion when you're doing it?

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. Of course.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Because you can't fake that, right?

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: No, you're in it. That's the beauty of it. That's why I wanted to do this job in the first place is to be in the scene. You know, feel the energy of the scene. And just all that comes with it. And it's -- you get totally wrapped up in it.They've been putting these cameras on us, you know? They've been showing the announcers. Kevin Harlan (ph) had one that kind of blew up on social. So, I'm a little hesitant to be seen in the moment like this. But, yes, this was some game. And one of the best games I've seen, I've been doing the tournament since 2012. This Kansas State/Michigan State game was right up there with one of the best I've ever seen and called. It was -- it was something.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: How about that moment?

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: The Wildcats star point guard Markquis Nowell. And there's this moment, let's play it as we talk about it. Why don't you walk through people, what's happening here?

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Well, OK. So, there's two versions of it. Was it a bit (ph)? That's the question. They said after the game, Jerome Tang, the head coach, and Markquis Nowell said, no, they were actually arguing, and then he saw his teammate, backdoor cut, and he through the lob to him. But, I don't know, it may have looked like a little bit of a play, playing a little possum. You get the defense to fall asleep, and then, boom. So, its artistry. It's a beautiful play. And it was a key play in the game as well.What do you guys think? You think it was fake?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Whatever it was, it worked. I mean can we -- if we can play it again because at - look, you can see a lot of things out -- things out of your periphery.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: He doesn't exactly look over.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It doesn't look like he looks over, right?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But, I mean, he's -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Barely.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: I mean this is like Broadway's right down the road, are they acting?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Are they -- is it real? It was -- it was a monumental moment. And I think it certainly took Michigan State by surprise.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Did it surprise you?

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Yes, it did, because I'm thinking, there may be a time out here. They're -- they're - they're arguing while the point guard is dribbling up the floor. HARLOW

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: That's somewhat normal, but to be able to spring it into action that quick and then fire that lob (ph).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: He had an amazing game.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But -- that's like Markquis Nowell, he had - what, he's a record all-time -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Nineteen assists.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Nineteen assists. He's from Harlem.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Poppy dropping stats.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Right here in New York City.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I mean the producers wrote it on the sheet.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, we're -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Can we -- are we really - are we --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm trying to read the stats without my glasses.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Put the glasses on, Don.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I know, I'm like, wait a minute. Let me look.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: You can just ask. I (INAUDIBLE) -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I mean really - are you really going to pretend that I know what happened last night.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: So he set a record for assists in a game. Assists when you set up your teammate for a point. So, he scored 20 himself, but he actually assisted 19.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Did you just define assistant for me?

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: OK, I do know that.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And he just scolded me. Put on your glasses, Don.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Based on our earlier conversation, I thought we were going to have to peel off a couple layers there.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: We need - we needed Kaitlan.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: But, anyway, so, he also had five steals. When you take a ball away from the other team.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: OK, OK, OK, OK.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: So, he had the steel at the end of the game that basically secured the game. So, one team scored more points than the other, and that's how you get a breakaway (ph).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God, I'm leaving.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: So, anyway, that's how it ended. So, he ended up making a layup at the end of the game for a five-point win. So, if you're a gambler, that might have an effect. But -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Didn't you ask -- was that yesterday or the day before -- what a transport portal was?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Oh, a transfer portal.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. I was like -- we had this -

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Oh, you don't know about the transfer portal.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's kind of - it's kind of self-explanatory, Poppy.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I was like, what are they talking about? I hope they don't come to me next.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Are we up for a -

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: We'll get into it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Any upsets or surprises tonight?

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Oh, I mean, we're always up for it in the tournament. That's why it's the madness. I think, you know, Princeton's going to be fun to watch tonight. The two number one seeds are in play tonight. Alabama and Houston.So, there's been a lot of turnover. There's been teams -- mid majors teams that -- like Florida Atlantic, who won our second game last night -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Is now in the Elite eight and will match up against Kansas State (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Can you say something nice about Alabama for Kaitlan, because she's gone today.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Of course. Well, they're the overall number one seed. They are the team that is expected to win the national championship.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: To win. I -- I know what that means.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: So, they have all the pressure.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Brian.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Thank you, Brian.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Good to be here.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Appreciate it. Have a great weekend.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You were great.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And we'll be watching and listening, most of all.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Yes, and Poppy's dialed in the stats. Nice going.
